III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code Sufficiency of staff.
Title
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4126
Section (1) The licensee shall have a sufficient number of administrative,
Description supervisory, social service, direct care, and other staff on duty to
perform the prescribed functions required by these administrative
rules and in the agency's program statement and to provide for the
continual needs, protection, and supervision of residents
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation Youth A has significant yellow, bluish bruising on the bilateral side
of their neck, raising concern for strangulation. The youth's neck
is very swollen on both sides and has hoarseness when speaking.
It's unknown who caused the strangulation, but it is known that it
was not self-inflicted.
Investigation Interviews:
Health Department Nurse was interviewed via phone on
December 17, 2024, in collaboration with MDHHS Worker.
Health Department Nurse reported she saw Youth A today for his
immunizations and was concerned about the bruising on the neck.
She reported she asked Youth A what happened, and he stated
that he didn’t do it to himself. Health Department Nurse reported
Youth A also denied someone hurting him. She reported she was
concerned that the bruising looked like strangulation and Youth A
would not provide details on what occurred to cause these
bruises.
Youth A was interviewed face to face at the facility on
December 17, 2024, in collaboration with MDHHS Worker.
Youth A’s neck was viewed by this consultant and MDHHS
Worker where there were healing bruises at all different stages
around his neck. When asked about the buries on his neck, Youth
A reported Youth B gave him “hickeys” by sucking on his neck on
different occasions. He reported he is dating Youth B. Youth A
2

reported these hickeys occurred in front of staff on several
different occasions at the facility in the TV room and Game room.
He reported staff were sitting within arm’s length of Youth A and
Youth B in these rooms and constantly were supervising. Youth A
reported Youth B would suck on his neck in a way so staff could
not see. He reported he could not remember the timeline of when
these occurred or what staff were supervising. Youth A reported
staff are constantly redirecting him and Youth B to maintain
appropriate space from one another, but they just ignore the
redirections. Youth A reported staff have never caused him
physical harm and never caused the bruising on his neck. He
reported that he feels safe at the facility.
Youth B was interviewed face to face at the facility on
December 17, 2024, in collaboration with MDHHS Worker.
Youth B reported she is aware of the bruising on Youth A’s neck
because she caused the bruising by giving him “hickeys”. When
asked to explain what a “hickey” was, she reported she put her
mouth up to his neck and suck hard with her mouth. Youth B
reported that she has given Youth A hickeys multiple times at the
facility in the TV room and Game room. She reported staff are
present when it occurs and explained she will lay her head on his
shoulder and suck on his neck for only ten seconds so staff
cannot realize what is going on. Youth B reported she does not
remember the exact days when this occurred and the only staff,
she remembers some of the staff that were supervising, were Staff
1 and Staff 2. She reported that staff sit within arm’s length
watching them and constantly verbally redirecting them to
separate but they ignore the staff. Youth B reported that she
would also give him hickeys when they hug. She reported staff are
constantly supervising and redirecting them. Youth B reported that
is why she ran away with Youth A before to Walgreens so they
could be alone. She reported they attempted to have sex at
Walgreens, but things didn’t work out and they came back. Youth
B reported staff have never put their hands around Youth A’s neck
and has never caused him physical harm. She reported staff will
only restrain a youth when they are harming themselves or others.
Youth B reported she feels safe at the facility.
Staff 1 was interviewed face to face at the facility on
December 17, 2024, in collaboration with MDHHS Worker.
Staff 1 reported that he has had to redirect Youth B from putting
her head on Youth A’s shoulder. He reported that sometimes
Youth A and Youth B will follow the redirection to separate but
sometimes they do not. Staff 1 reported he has never seen Youth
B give Youth A a hickey. He reported he will constantly supervise
3

Youth A and Youth B by sitting within arm’s length of them. Staff 1
reported he has no concerns with other staff not following this
supervision requirement due to their behaviors. He reported if the
staff that are supervising Youth A and Youth B need to switch out
due to needing to do something else or use the restroom, another
staff will come switch so there is constant supervision. Staff 1
reported that he has never heard or seen concerns of Youth A
being strangled by anyone, including a staff. He reported the
concerns are these bruises are coming from Youth B giving
hickeys to Youth A due to them running away from the facility at
times.
Staff 2 was interviewed face to face at the facility on
December 18, 2024, in collaboration with MDHHS Worker.
Staff 2 reported he was aware of the marks on Youth A’s neck,
and he reported it was from Youth B giving him hickeys. He
reported Youth B is refusing to keep her mouth off Youth A’s neck
when redirected. Staff 2 reported the first time he saw the mark on
Youth A’s neck, Youth A tried to state it was from him falling
asleep on his mp3 player. He reported there is a precautions plan
that was put into place for Youth A and Youth B where staff need
to constantly be watching and redirecting them to maintain
appropriate boundaries. Staff 2 reported he remembered one
incident where both Youth A and Youth B were sitting next to one
another on the couch and each had individual blankets, Staff 2
reported they were both redirected to not sit next to one another or
have the blankets. He reported Youth B would continue to hide
under the blanket and would snuggle up next to Youth A. Staff 2
reported he would constantly redirect and did hear a sucking noise
under the blanket. He reported when he would redirect, she would
stop. Staff 2 reported he constantly sat within arm’s length of the
two youth. He reported he does not have concerns about other
staff not supervising the youth. Staff 2 reported he has never
heard or seen any strangulation concerns either at the facility.
Supervisor was interviewed face to face at the facility on
December 17, 2024, in collaboration with MDHHS Worker.
Supervisor reported she has noticed the bruising on Youth A’s
neck and believes they are to be hickeys from Youth B. She
reported the two of them are on safety plans to be separate from
one another due to their history. Supervisor said that staff are to
be within arm's length of Youth A and Youth B and continue to
redirect their behavior. She reported that Youth A and Youth B do
not always follow the redirection. Supervisor reported she had
asked Youth A about the bruises, and he has come up with stories
about something causing the bruising. She reported she had
4

never heard a disclosure of staff causing the bruising. Supervisor
reported she has never seen staff cause physical harm to Youth A
or any of the youth at the facility. She reported Youth A and Youth
B have been in multiple investigations recently about touching one
another or inappropriate behaviors. Supervisor reported the staff
are doing their best to redirect the behavior and provide constant
supervision.
Foster Care Worker was interviewed via phone on December
17, 2024. Foster Care Worker reported she completed a face-to-
face visit with Youth A on December 16, 2024, and noticed the
bruising on his neck. She reported Youth A disclosed these came
from another youth at the facility that he is dating, and this youth
was giving him hickeys. Foster Care Worker reported she is aware
of these boundary concerns and noted the facility has put in
multiple safety plans to keep the two youth separated. She
reported from the incident reports she has received and the phone
calls she has received from the facility, the staff are doing
everything they can do to keep the two youth separated. Foster
Care Worker reported Youth A does not do well with listening to
redirections. She reported she has no concerns with the facility's
level of supervision or intervention.
Documents Reviewed:
- Youth A’s Safety Provision Plan/ Safety Plan with last
review date of 12/02/2024- This plan reports staff are to be
within arm’s length of Youth A when he is in three feet
proximity with Youth B. Staff are to verbally redirect both
youths to separate and be attentive to the situation.
- Facility Incident reports involving Youth A and Youth
B-
o 12/1/2024- Reported concerns of Youth A and Youth
B having sexual intercourse at the YWCA. This is
being investigated withing DCWL Special
Investigation 2025SIC0000164.
o 12/02/2024- Staff were sitting in the tv room with
Youth A and Youth B. Another youth came into the
room to ask the staff a question that lasted no longer
than 15 seconds, when they looked back Youth A
and Youth B were kissing. Staff immediately
redirected and separated the two youth by verbal
redirection.
o 12/05/2024- Staff noticed Youth A had a mark on the
side of his neck, which staff noted to look like a
hickey. Youth A reported it was due to falling asleep
5

on his mp3 player. Youth A did not want any medical
attention.
o 12/9/2024- Youth A was in his room when Youth B
came into his doorway which then Youth A leaned
over to kiss the peer. Staff immediately redirected.
Later that same day, Youth A started kissing Youth
B when he thought staff were not looking. Staff
quickly intervened and prompted the two to separate
and reminded them about boundaries.
o 12/11/2024- Staff were assisting another peer and
Youth A snuck into the TV room to kiss Youth B.
Staff saw and quickly intervened prompting both to
separate. Youth A was upset by this and continued
to have inappropriate boundaries with Youth B on
and off throughout the night. Staff continued to
verbally redirect and remind both youth about
boundaries. Staff continued to maintain supervision.
o 12/12/2024- Youth A and Youth B ran away from the
facility and were found at the local Walgreens.
AWOL protocol was followed.
- Facility Supervision of Coed Milieu Policy- The policy
notes that staff should be monitoring the interactions of the
youth by being available in the milieu and interacting with
those residing in the program. This would include
monitoring to ensure that the youth are maintaining
appropriate boundaries within the home.
- Staff 1 Human Resource File- Staff 1 has no disciplinary
actions within his HR file. Staff 1 is up to date on all
required trainings, including Role of Direct Care Staff where
Supervision guidelines were reviewed on 10/08/2024.
- Staff 2 Human Resource File- Staff 1 has no disciplinary
actions within his HR file. Staff 2 is up to date on all
required trainings, including Role of Direct Care Staff where
Supervision guidelines were reviewed on 07/15/2024.
Analysis The agency is found in compliance as per staff and youth
interviews and documentation reviewed, the bruises came from
Youth B sucking on Youth A’s neck. Staff were providing adequate
supervision and redirection but both youths refused to separate. It
should be noted Youth A has since been moved from this facility.
Conclusion Violation Not Established

licensing statutes and rules. It is recommended that the current license status be
continued.
